instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no power. It has 5V on amp meter,but pulls 0A.

I have 5.2V on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_E85_SS</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.2V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> = 0V

I'm looking for the CD3215A but can't find it on this board, and not even sure if that's relevant in this case...

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This model doesn't use <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
<CHIP>U4700</CHIP>/80 are known as common failure.
Check diode mode to ground on  <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
I've replaced <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and 4780 but without success.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>  = 0V and  <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> = 0V . None is shorted.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Actual diode mode to ground at  <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Looks still too low.
Could be <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, or other chip connected there.
Continue with <CHIP>U4400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4650</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
HI,
I've replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U4400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4650</CHIP>, but same result.
Any more ideas?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check again that diode mode reading.
Should be higher than 400; compare with other board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I have 0.340mV. Don´t have any other board of this model to compare. 
Do you think that this diode value isen't OK?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power

Also Louis should have some video about this board.
